metadata.title: CVE-2019-11884 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The do_hidp_sock_ioctl function in net/bluetooth/hidp/sock.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.0.15 allows a local user to obtain potentially sensitiveinformation from kernel stack memory via a HIDPCONNADD command, because aname field may not end with a '\0' character.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
